eu.geclipse.core.model
Interface IGridElementCreator

All Known Subinterfaces:
IGridJobCreator, IStorableElementCreator
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractFileElementCreator, AbstractGridElementCreator, AbstractGridJobCreator, FileSystemCreator, GenericVoCreator, GridJobCreator, GridProjectCreator, LocalResourceCreator
public interface IGridElementCreator

Base interface for all classes that implement functionality for creating specific implementations of the IGridElement interface. Element creates contain mainly two types of methods, the canCreate(...) methods and the create(...) methods. Therefore an element creator can be asked if it is potentially able to create an element and if so it can be asked to really try to create the element. It is not necessarily true that the creator can create an element if it returns true when asked if it can. It may also the case that there occurs an error during the creation of the element even if it should in principal be possible to create an element. If any of the canCreate(...) methods is called with an argument this argument is stored if the method returns true until another canCreate(...) method is called with an argument and returns true. This stored argument can be retrieved with the getObject() method.

Method Summary
 boolean canCreate(java.lang.Class<? extends IGridElement> elementType)
          Ask this creator if it is able to create elements of the specified type.
 boolean canCreate(java.lang.Object fromObject)
          Ask this creator if it is able to create elements from the specified object.
 IGridElement create(IGridContainer parent)
          Create an element and set it to be a child of the specified IGridContainer.
 java.lang.Object getObject()
          Get the argument of the last successful call of any of the canCreate(...) methods.
 

Method Detail

canCreate

boolean canCreate(java.lang.Class<? extends IGridElement> elementType)
Ask this creator if it is able to create elements of the specified type. If this methods returns true the element type will be remembered until another call of any of the canCreate(...) methods. This element type can afterwards retrieved with the getObject() method.

Parameters:
elementType - The type of the element that should be created.
Returns:
True if this element creator is potentially able to create an element of the specified type.

canCreate

boolean canCreate(java.lang.Object fromObject)
Ask this creator if it is able to create elements from the specified object. If this methods returns true the object will be remembered until another call of any of the canCreate(...) methods. This object can afterwards retrieved with the getObject() method.

Parameters:
fromObject - The object from which to create an element.
Returns:
True if this creator is potentially able to create elements from the specified object.

create

IGridElement create(IGridContainer parent)
                    throws GridModelException
Create an element and set it to be a child of the specified IGridContainer. The element is created from the object that is returned by the getObject() method. If the creation fails a GridModelException will be thrown.

Parameters:
parent - The parent of the newly created element.
Returns:
The newly created element.
Throws:
GridModelException - If any problem occurs during the new element is created.

getObject

java.lang.Object getObject()
Get the argument of the last successful call of any of the canCreate(...) methods. A successful call is a call that returned true.

Returns:
The argument of the last successful call of a canCreate(...) method. This may be null if no such method was called before or if the argument was null itself. This method is used by create(IGridContainer) to get the object from which to create the new element.
